name: heat production, softwood chips from forest, at furnace 50kW | heat, central or small-scale, other than natural gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3294/documentation

This activity represents the combustion of natural wood chips from forest in Switzerland and is used for the global activity as first approximation with uncertainty factors adjusted accordingly. Characteristics of the of wood chips to be burned: Dry wood density 430kg/m3; Energy content (LHV, oven-dry) 19.1 MJ/kg. The humidity when burned is assumed to be at an adequate level for appropriate combustion after some weeks of drying in the storage. Air emission factors as well as the boiler efficiency represent average annual operation including start and stop (warm-up and shut-down). Therefore, emission data will be higher and efficiency will be lower than rated values provided by manufacturers. The inventory shall be considered as being representative also for boilers with nominal capacities below 70kW. ;;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - heat production, softwood chips from forest, at furnace 50kW, GLO, 2000 - 2001 (a8aa8240-f0ba-4778-8848-724cc57e4331)]

from delivery of wood chips

This activity describes the combustion of natural wood chips from forest. Included are the infrastructure, the wood requirements (softwood chips from forest), the emissions to air, the electricity needed for operation, and the disposal of the ashes.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Key emission factors PM, CO, NMVOC, CH4, NOx as well as the average annual efficiency have been updated using the latest available information. Other emission data are from the second half of the 1990´s.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: LCI data for Switzerland were used for the GLO activityy as first approximation with uncertainty factors adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Boiler of average technology available on the Swiss market.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description:
The numbers used in the mathematical relation refer to the input of one MJ of fuel with the heat output depending on the efficiency of the furnace. Using the "scling factor" (inverse of the efficiency) allows for scaling of the amount of the reference product to 1.
